result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. GARRETT A. SPARKMAN

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM Defendant GARRETT A. SPARKMAN appeared by video from DCI, in custody.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for GARRETT A. SPARKMAN.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  The sound for DCI will not connect, he can hear us but we can't hear him.  The Court will set another ARGN date.  Attorney Rae puts on the record that this case will be a plea/sent at the next hearing.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waushara County Jail. 10/17 @ 8:30.  Not sent to transport.

NO CONTACT WITH V1 WSC #22-1143. You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.  

**Faxed signature bond to Waushara County**

8:30 am Defendant GARRETT A. SPARKMAN appeared by video from Waushara County. Attorney Morgan Rae in court for GARRETT A. SPARKMAN.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. Given/has complaint. Waive reading.Advised of Rights. Waiver of Prelim. Probable Cause Found. Defendant bound over. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present to make a statement.  8:34 Record closed.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Email Confirmation from Waushara County Jail - Zoom scheduled for 9/19 @ 8:30 a.m.
Waushara County Jail - 9/19/22 (CLERK TO SET UP ZOOM - CONFIRMED VIA EMAIL)
